intro: Calyptropsidium bracteosum, commonly known as the bracteose calyptropsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typical of many members of its family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Calyptropsidium bracteosum is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
